metadata.title: Single-species Stock Assessment Model for the Eastern Bering Sea Pollock

creators.name: Atmospheric Administration (NOAA), National Marine Fisheries Service (NMFS), Alaska Fisheries Science Center (AFSC)

metadata.description:
Single-species stock assessment model developed for the Eastern Bering Sea pollock including predation.  Model spatial coverage is across eastern Bering Sea and Gulf of Alaska pollock distributions.  Model inputs are fisheries data and predator biomass. Model outputs pollock population and mortality trends - number at age and biomass at age.  

[ Reference: Livingston, P.A. and R.D. Methot. 1998. Incorporation of predation into a population assessment model of eastern Bering Sea walleye pollock. P. 663-678. In: Fishery Stock Assessment Models. Alaska Sea Grant College Program Publication AK-SG-98-01. 1037p. ]  

[ Reference: PICES Scientific Report No. 18 2001, Proceedings of the PICES/CoML/IPRC Workshop on "Impact of Climate Variability on Observation and Prediction of Ecosystem and Biodiversity Changes in the North Pacific", http://www.pices.int/publications/scientific_reports/Report18/default.aspx. ]
metadata.notes:
Purpose: To understand more clearly the sources and time trends of natural mortality for pollock, by explicitly incorporating predation mortality induced by their major predators into an age-structured fish stock assessment model.

Status: In Progress

Maintenance frequency: Annually
